00001 ##################################################
00002 ##################################################
00003 #
00004 #  Subclasses of the Interval, Set, and Union classes
00005 #  that stringify as inequalities
00006 #
00007 
00008 #
00009 #  Some common routines to all three classes
00010 #
00011 package Inequalities::common;
00012 
00013 #
00014 #  Turn the object back into its usual Value version
00015 #
00016 sub demote {
00017   my $self = shift;  my $context = $self->context;
00018   my $other = shift; $other = $self unless defined $other;
00019   return $other unless Value::classMatch($other,"Inequality");
00020   $context->Package($other->type)->make($context,$other->makeData);
00021 }
00022 
00023 #
00024 #  Needed to get Interval data in the right order for make(),
00025 #  and demote all the items in a Union
00026 #
00027 sub makeData {(shift)->value}
00028 
00029 #
00030 #  Recursively mark Intervals and Sets in a Union as Inequalities
00031 #
00032 sub updateParts {}
00033 
00034 #
00035 #  Demote the operands to normal Value objects and
00036 #  perform the action, then remake the result into
00037 #  an Inequality again.
00038 #
00039 sub apply {
00040   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00041   my $method = shift;  my $other = shift;
00042   $context->Package("Inequality")->new($context,
00043     $self->demote->$method($self->demote($other),@_),
00044     $self->{varName});
00045 }
00046 
00047 sub add {(shift)->apply("add",@_)}
00048 sub sub {(shift)->apply("sub",@_)}
00049 sub reduce {(shift)->apply("reduce",@_)}
00050 sub intersect {(shift)->apply("intersect",@_)}
00051 
00052 #
00053 #  The name to use for error messages in answer checkers
00054 #
00055 sub class {"Inequality"}
00056 sub cmp_class {"an Inequality"}
00057 sub showClass {"an Inequality"}
00058 sub typeRef {
00059   my $self = shift;
00060   return Value::Type($self->type, $self->length, $Value::Type{number});
00061 }
00062 
00063 #
00064 #  Get the precedence based on the type rather than the class.
00065 #
00066 sub precedence {
00067   my $self = shift; my $precedence = $self->context->{precedence};
00068   return $precedence->{$self->type}-$precedence->{Interval}+$precedence->{$self->class};
00069 }
00070 
00071 #
00072 #  Produce better error messages for inequalities
00073 #
00074 sub cmp_checkUnionReduce {
00075   my $self = shift; my $student = shift; my $ans = shift; my $nth = shift || '';
00076   if (Value::classMatch($student,"Inequality")) {
00077     return unless $ans->{studentsMustReduceUnions} &&
00078                   $ans->{showUnionReduceWarnings} &&
00079                   !$ans->{isPreview} && !Value::isFormula($student);
00080     my ($result,$error) = $student->isReduced;
00081     return unless $error;
00082     return {
00083       "overlaps" => "Your$nth answer contains overlapping inequalities",
00084       "overlaps in sets" => "Your$nth answer contains equalities that are already included elsewhere",
00085       "uncombined intervals" => "Your$nth answer can be simplified by combining some inequalities",
00086       "uncombined sets" => "",          #  shouldn't get this from inequalities
00087       "repeated elements in set" => "Your$nth answer contains repeated values",
00088       "repeated elements" => "Your$nth answer contains repeated values",
00089     }->{$error};
00090   } else {
00091     return unless Value::can($student,"isReduced");
00092     return Value::cmp_checkUnionReduce($self,$student,$ans,$nth,@_)
00093   }
00094 }
